title: Epic: CLI & Server Core
description: Implement main.go entry point, serve command, CLI flags, LLM-friendly help output, and HTTP server startup with graceful shutdown.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 1: agentviewer-0ml.5 | Implemented graceful shutdown with SIGINT/SIGTERM handling, Hub.Shutdown() method, and HTTP server graceful shutdown with 10s timeout | Also closed tasks 0ml.1-4 that were already implemented

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 2: agentviewer-0ml.6 | Verified --open flag functionality was already implemented (OpenBrowser in server.go, flag handling in main.go). Added server_test.go with TestOpenBrowser unit test. All tests pass.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 3: agentviewer-0ml.7 | Verified initial file loading was already implemented in main.go (lines 98-133). Added render_test.go with comprehensive tests for DetectContentType (16 cases), DetectLanguage (60+ mappings), ReadFileContent, and CreateUnifiedDiff. All tests pass. Epic complete - all 7 tasks closed.

title: Implement main.go with serve subcommand
description: Create main.go with 'serve' subcommand. Use stdlib flag package or minimal CLI parsing. Support: agentviewer serve [OPTIONS] [FILE]

title: Implement CLI flags: --port, --open, --type, --title
description: Add flags: --port/-p (default 3333), --open/-o (open browser), --type/-t (markdown/code/diff/auto), --title (tab title). Parse and validate.

title: Implement LLM-friendly --help output
description: Custom help output with structured sections: USAGE, DESCRIPTION, OPTIONS, CONTENT TYPES, API ENDPOINTS, EXAMPLES. Include curl examples inline. See SPEC.md for exact format.

title: Implement HTTP server startup in server.go
description: Create Server struct, start HTTP server on 127.0.0.1:PORT. Set up routing with http.ServeMux. Bind to localhost only (security).

title: Implement graceful shutdown with signal handling
description: Handle SIGINT/SIGTERM, gracefully close WebSocket connections, shutdown HTTP server with timeout context.
close_reason: Implemented SIGINT/SIGTERM handling with graceful shutdown of WebSocket hub and HTTP server

title: Implement --open flag to launch browser
description: When --open flag set, use exec.Command to open default browser (open on macOS, xdg-open on Linux, start on Windows) pointing to localhost:PORT.

title: Load initial file from CLI argument
description: If FILE argument provided, read file, auto-detect type (or use --type), create initial tab on server start.

title: Create image test files (.png, .jpg, .svg)
description: Create testdata/ image files: sample.png, sample.jpg, sample.svg for testing image file support and rendering.

title: Support pure Mermaid files (.mmd, .mermaid)
description: Add TabTypeMermaid for standalone mermaid diagram files. Detect .mmd and .mermaid extensions and render as mermaid diagrams in the frontend.

title: Create Mermaid test files (.mmd)
description: Create testdata/sample.mmd with various diagram types: flowchart, sequence, class, state, ER diagrams for testing mermaid file support.

title: Epic: Testing
description: Implement unit tests, API e2e tests, and browser smoke tests using Go testing, httptest, and chromedp.

title: Write unit tests for tab state management
description: Test Tab CRUD operations: create, update, get, list, delete, clear. Test ID generation, ordering, active tab tracking. Table-driven tests.

title: Create markdown test files (GFM, tables, task lists)
Create markdown test files with Mermaid diagrams
Create markdown test files with LaTeX math
Create code test files for multiple languages (Go, TS, Python, etc.)
Write unit tests for REST API handlers
description: Use httptest to test each endpoint. Test success cases, error cases (404, 400), JSON parsing. Mock state as needed.

title: Write unit tests for content detection
description: Test content type detection, language detection from various file extensions. Test edge cases.

title: Write WebSocket unit tests
description: Test hub registration/unregistration, message broadcasting, client message handling. Use gorilla/websocket test utilities.

title: Write API e2e tests (full server)
description: E2E tests that start real server on random port, exercise full API flow: create tabs, update, list, delete. Use build tag e2e.

title: Write CLI e2e tests
description: Test built binary: serve command, flags, help output. Use exec.Command to run binary, verify behavior.

title: Write browser smoke tests with chromedp
description: Use chromedp for lightweight browser testing. Test: page loads, tabs render, content displays, WebSocket updates work. Build tag e2e.

title: Create test fixtures in testdata/
description: Create testdata/ directory with sample files: sample.md, sample.go, sample.diff for use in tests.
close_reason: Superseded by more specific test file tasks: 6n7.10-15

title: Set up GitHub Actions CI workflow
description: Create .github/workflows/test.yml: run unit tests, run e2e tests, report coverage. Test on ubuntu-latest with Go 1.22+.

title: Epic: REST API
description: Implement all REST API endpoints in handlers.go: tab CRUD, activation, status. JSON request/response handling.
close_reason: All REST API endpoints implemented and tested: POST/GET/DELETE tabs, GET/DELETE tab by ID, activate tab, status endpoint. Comprehensive test coverage in handlers_test.go.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 1: agentviewer-a8p.1 | POST /api/tabs was already fully implemented in handlers.go:68-149 - handles JSON parsing, file reading, diff content, ID generation, WebSocket broadcast, and returns metadata with created flag | No blockers

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 2: agentviewer-a8p.2 | GET /api/tabs was already fully implemented in handlers.go:152-164 with route at server.go:64 - returns ListTabsResponse with TabSummary array (id, title, type, active) | No code changes needed, tests pass

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 3: agentviewer-a8p.3 | GET /api/tabs/{id} already fully implemented in handlers.go:166-175, route at server.go:65 - returns complete Tab object with 404 for non-existent IDs | No code changes needed, verified with manual test

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 4: agentviewer-a8p.4 | DELETE /api/tabs/{id} already fully implemented in handlers.go:177-189 with route at server.go:66 - deletes tab, stores for reopen, broadcasts tab_deleted via WS, returns 204 | No code changes needed, all tests pass

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 5: agentviewer-a8p.6 | POST /api/tabs/{id}/activate already fully implemented in handlers.go:191-203 with route at server.go:67 - sets tab as active, broadcasts tab_activated via WS, returns 204 on success or 404 for non-existent tabs | No code changes needed, verified with manual test

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 6: agentviewer-a8p.8 | Added request validation for tab type (must be markdown/code/diff/empty) and diff data requirements. Created comprehensive handlers_test.go with 13 tests covering validation errors (invalid JSON, invalid type, diff without data), 404 responses, and all API endpoints. | No blockers

title: Implement POST /api/tabs (create/update tab)
description: Accept JSON with id, title, type, content OR file, diff. Support both inline content and file path. Generate ID if not provided. Return tab metadata with created flag.
close_reason: Already fully implemented - handleCreateTab in handlers.go:68-149 handles JSON parsing, file reading, diff content, ID generation, and returns metadata with created flag

title: Implement GET /api/tabs (list tabs)
description: Return JSON array of all tabs with id, title, type, active flag. Maintain tab order.

title: Implement GET /api/tabs/:id (get tab content)
description: Return full tab object including content. Return 404 if tab not found.

title: Implement DELETE /api/tabs/:id (delete tab)
description: Remove tab by ID. Return 404 if not found. Broadcast deletion via WebSocket.

title: Implement DELETE /api/tabs (clear all tabs)
description: Remove all tabs. Broadcast clear event via WebSocket.
close_reason: DELETE /api/tabs already implemented in handlers.go:226-233 with test in handlers_test.go:269-295

title: Implement POST /api/tabs/:id/activate
description: Set active tab by ID. Return 404 if tab not found. Broadcast activation via WebSocket.

title: Implement GET /api/status
description: Return server status: version string, tab count, uptime in seconds.
close_reason: GET /api/status already implemented in handlers.go:236-243 with test in handlers_test.go:297-326

title: Implement request validation and error responses
description: Validate required fields (type for create). Return proper HTTP status codes: 400 for bad request, 404 for not found, 500 for server errors. JSON error responses.

title: Support image files (.png, .jpg, .gif, .svg, .webp)
description: Add TabTypeImage for image files. Detect common image extensions and render as inline images in the frontend. Consider base64 encoding for API transport or serving from filesystem.

title: Epic: Diff Rendering
description: Implement side-by-side diff view supporting both two-file comparison and unified diff input.

title: Implement two-file diff comparison in render.go
description: Read two files, compute diff using Go diff library. Generate unified diff or line-by-line comparison data for frontend.

title: Implement unified diff parsing in render.go
description: Parse unified diff format (git diff output). Extract file names, hunks, additions, deletions. Pass structured data to frontend.

title: Implement side-by-side diff view in frontend
description: Render diff as side-by-side view using diff2html or custom implementation. Show left (original) and right (modified) panes.

title: Add syntax highlighting to diff view
description: Apply syntax highlighting to diff content based on file extension or specified language. Color additions green, deletions red.

title: Add line numbers and navigation to diff view
description: Show line numbers for both sides. Add navigation controls to jump between changes. Highlight current change.

title: Implement collapsible unchanged sections
description: Collapse large unchanged sections with 'N lines hidden' indicator. Click to expand. Keep context lines around changes.

title: Style diff view for dark/light themes
description: CSS for diff container, split panes, addition/deletion highlighting. Support dark and light color schemes.

title: Epic: WebSocket
description: Implement WebSocket hub pattern in websocket.go for real-time browser updates. Handle connections, broadcasting, and client messages.
close_reason: All WebSocket functionality implemented: Hub with channels, WS upgrade handler at /ws, server-to-client messages (tab_created/updated/deleted/activated/tabs_cleared), client-to-server messages (activate_tab/close_tab), connection error handling with ping/pong

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 8: Closed all 6 child tasks and epic | All WebSocket functionality was already implemented in websocket.go and handlers.go: Hub struct with register/unregister/broadcast channels, WS upgrade handler at /ws, server-to-client messages (tab_created/updated/deleted/activated/tabs_cleared), client-to-server handling (activate_tab/close_tab), connection cleanup with ping/pong keepalive | No blockers

title: Implement WebSocket Hub struct and goroutine
description: Create Hub struct managing client connections. Run hub in dedicated goroutine. Handle register, unregister, broadcast channels.

title: Implement WebSocket upgrade handler at /ws
description: HTTP handler that upgrades connection to WebSocket. Register client with hub. Handle connection lifecycle.

title: Implement server-to-client message types
description: Define and implement: tab_created, tab_updated, tab_deleted, tab_activated, content_updated, tabs_cleared. JSON serialization.

title: Implement client-to-server message handling
description: Handle activate_tab and close_tab messages from browser. Parse JSON, call appropriate state methods.

title: Integrate WebSocket broadcasts with tab state changes
description: Wire up tab CRUD operations to broadcast appropriate WebSocket messages. Ensure all state changes notify connected browsers.

title: Handle WebSocket connection errors and cleanup
description: Gracefully handle disconnects, ping/pong for keepalive, connection timeouts. Clean up dead connections from hub.

title: Epic: File Handling & Content Detection
description: Implement render.go: file reading, content type auto-detection, language detection from file extensions.

title: Implement file reading with path validation
description: ReadFile(path) function. Validate path exists, is readable file. Return content as string. Handle errors gracefully.

title: Implement content type auto-detection
description: DetectContentType(path, content) - infer markdown/code/diff from file extension (.md, .go, .diff, .patch). Default to code for unknown.

title: Implement language detection from file extension
description: DetectLanguage(path) - map file extensions to highlight.js language names. .go→go, .ts→typescript, .py→python, etc.

title: Implement security restrictions for file access
description: Validate file paths. Optional: restrict to certain directories, prevent path traversal attacks. Log file access.

title: Epic: Tab State Management
description: Implement in-memory tab state with thread-safe CRUD operations, tab ordering, and active tab tracking in tabs.go.
close_reason: All 7 child tasks completed. Tab State Management fully implemented with CRUD operations, tab ordering, active tab tracking, and tab reopen functionality.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 1: Closed all 7 tasks (ecz.1-ecz.7). Tasks ecz.1-ecz.6 were already implemented in tabs.go from prior work. Implemented ecz.7 (tab reopen/undo close) with ReopenTab(), ClosedTabCount(), modified DeleteTab() to store closed tabs, and comprehensive tests. Epic complete.

title: Define Tab and State structs
description: Create Tab struct with ID, Title, Type, Content, Language, DiffMeta, CreatedAt, UpdatedAt. Create State struct with sync.RWMutex, tabs map, order slice, activeID.
close_reason: Already implemented in tabs.go with Tab struct (ID, Title, Type, Content, Language, DiffMeta, Active, CreatedAt, UpdatedAt), DiffMeta struct, and State struct (sync.RWMutex, tabs map, order slice, activeID)

title: Implement CreateTab with ID generation
description: CreateTab(req) - if ID provided use it, else generate unique ID (nanoid or uuid). Add to tabs map and order slice. Return created tab.
close_reason: Already implemented in tabs.go - CreateTab with GenerateID (lines 63-99), upsert behavior built into CreateTab, GetTab (lines 101-114), ListTabs (lines 147-161), DeleteTab (lines 116-145), Clear (lines 183-191), SetActive (lines 163-174)

title: Implement UpdateTab (upsert behavior)
description: UpdateTab(id, content) - if tab exists, update content and UpdatedAt. If not exists, create new. Handle both inline content and file path.
close_reason: Already implemented in tabs.go - CreateTab with GenerateID (lines 63-99), upsert behavior built into CreateTab, GetTab (lines 101-114), ListTabs (lines 147-161), DeleteTab (lines 116-145), Clear (lines 183-191), SetActive (lines 163-174)

title: Implement GetTab and ListTabs
description: GetTab(id) returns single tab or error. ListTabs() returns all tabs in order with active flag.
close_reason: Already implemented in tabs.go - CreateTab with GenerateID (lines 63-99), upsert behavior built into CreateTab, GetTab (lines 101-114), ListTabs (lines 147-161), DeleteTab (lines 116-145), Clear (lines 183-191), SetActive (lines 163-174)

title: Implement DeleteTab and ClearTabs
description: DeleteTab(id) removes tab from map and order slice. ClearTabs() removes all tabs. Handle active tab switching on delete.
close_reason: Already implemented in tabs.go - CreateTab with GenerateID (lines 63-99), upsert behavior built into CreateTab, GetTab (lines 101-114), ListTabs (lines 147-161), DeleteTab (lines 116-145), Clear (lines 183-191), SetActive (lines 163-174)

title: Implement SetActiveTab
description: SetActiveTab(id) - validate tab exists, update activeID. Return error if tab not found.
close_reason: Already implemented in tabs.go - CreateTab with GenerateID (lines 63-99), upsert behavior built into CreateTab, GetTab (lines 101-114), ListTabs (lines 147-161), DeleteTab (lines 116-145), Clear (lines 183-191), SetActive (lines 163-174)

title: Implement tab reopen (undo close)
description: Keep recently closed tabs in memory (last N). Implement ReopenTab() to restore most recently closed tab. Nice-to-have feature.
close_reason: Implemented ReopenTab and ClosedTabCount functions. DeleteTab now stores closed tabs (up to 10). Added comprehensive tests for LIFO behavior, property preservation, ID collision handling, and max limit.

title: Epic: Project Setup & Infrastructure
description: Initialize Go project, set up dependencies, create project structure, and configure build pipeline.
close_reason: All subtasks completed: Go module initialized, dependencies added, project structure created, go:embed configured, vendor libraries downloaded and embedded

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 2: agentviewer-ge9.1 | Installed Go 1.25.5 via Homebrew and initialized go.mod with module path github.com/pengelbrecht/agentviewer | No blockers

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 3: agentviewer-ge9.6 | Created SETUP.md with minimal Mac Go setup instructions (homebrew install, env vars, verification) | No blockers

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 4: agentviewer-ge9.2 | Added nhooyr.io/websocket and chromedp dependencies, created main.go with websocket import and tools.go for test deps | No blockers

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 5: agentviewer-ge9.3 | Created complete project directory structure with all Go source files (main.go, server.go, websocket.go, tabs.go, handlers.go, render.go, static.go) and web assets (index.html, app.js, style.css, vendor/). Project builds successfully. | No blockers.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 6: agentviewer-ge9.5 | Changed go:embed directive from 'web/*' to 'web' for recursive directory embedding, added static_test.go with table-driven tests for embedded FS, content types, and static file serving | No blockers

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 7: agentviewer-ge9.4 | Downloaded and embedded all frontend vendor libraries (marked.js, highlight.js, mermaid.js, KaTeX with fonts, diff2html). Updated index.html with vendor includes and static.go with font MIME types. All tests pass.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 8: Closed epic | All 6 subtasks completed - Go module, dependencies, project structure, go:embed, vendor libraries all done | No blockers

title: Initialize Go module with go.mod
description: Run go mod init, set up module path as github.com/pengelbrecht/agentviewer

title: Add core Go dependencies
description: Add nhooyr.io/websocket (or gorilla/websocket) for WebSocket support. Use stdlib http.ServeMux (Go 1.22+) for routing.

title: Create project directory structure
description: Create web/ directory for embedded assets, web/vendor/ for JS libraries. Set up main.go, server.go, websocket.go, tabs.go, handlers.go, render.go files.

title: Download and embed frontend vendor libraries
description: Download marked.js (markdown), highlight.js (syntax), mermaid.js (diagrams), katex (math), diff2html (diffs). Place in web/vendor/ for embedding.

title: Set up go:embed for web assets
description: Configure //go:embed web/* directive to embed HTML, CSS, JS, and vendor files into the binary.

title: Document Mac Go development setup
description: Add SETUP.md with Mac Go best practices: install Go via homebrew, configure GOPATH/GOBIN, shell profile setup, verify go env. Keep minimal - no IDE config needed, just CLI/LLM workflow.

title: Epic: Frontend Core
description: Implement web UI shell: index.html, app.js, style.css. Tab bar, content area, WebSocket connection, dark/light mode.
close_reason: All children tasks completed: index.html shell, tab bar UI, content area rendering, WebSocket client, style.css with responsive layout, static file serving, dark/light mode toggle, and keyboard shortcuts. Full Frontend Core epic implementation complete.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 1: agentviewer-kx4.1 | Task was already complete - web/index.html already existed with semantic HTML, tab bar in header, content area in main, and all vendor script/style references. Build and tests verified passing.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 2: agentviewer-kx4.2 | Added middle-click to close tabs, prevented default browser behavior with auxclick handler, added max-width on tabs and text-overflow ellipsis for overflow handling. Tab bar already had overflow-x auto for horizontal scrolling. Tests pass, build successful.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 3: agentviewer-kx4.3 | Enhanced content area rendering to use vendor libraries (marked.js, highlight.js, diff2html, mermaid, KaTeX). Added post-render processing for markdown content including code highlighting, mermaid diagram rendering, and KaTeX math. Includes fallback implementations if vendor libs unavailable. Tests pass, build successful.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 4: agentviewer-kx4.4 | Enhanced WebSocket client with exponential backoff reconnection (1s to 30s max), try/catch for message parsing, and visual connection status indicator. Added CSS for status indicator with pulse animation. Tests pass, build successful.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 5: agentviewer-kx4.7 | Enhanced style.css with comprehensive CSS variables (colors, spacing, typography), added dark/light theme support with data-theme overrides, responsive breakpoints (480px, 768px, 1200px+), markdown typography, diff2html/mermaid/KaTeX integrations, print styles, and prefers-reduced-motion accessibility. Tests pass, build successful.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 6: agentviewer-kx4.8 | Task was already fully implemented - static.go has go:embed directive, ServeStaticFile with SPA fallback and content type detection; server.go routes GET / to handleStatic; handlers.go delegates to ServeStaticFile; comprehensive tests in static_test.go. All tests passing, build successful.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 7: agentviewer-kx4.5 | Implemented dark/light mode toggle with: theme toggle button in header with sun/moon icons, localStorage persistence for user preference, system preference detection via prefers-color-scheme, mermaid diagram theme sync. Tests pass, build successful.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 8: agentviewer-kx4.6 | Implemented keyboard shortcuts: Cmd/Ctrl+1-9 switch tabs, Cmd/Ctrl+W close tab (both already existed), added Cmd/Ctrl+Shift+T to reopen closed tabs with closedTabsHistory stack (up to 10 tabs), full content preservation, new unique ID generation on reopen. Tests pass, build successful.

title: Create index.html shell with tab bar and content area
description: Create web/index.html with semantic HTML: header with tab bar, main content area, basic structure. Include script/style references.
close_reason: index.html already existed with all required structure: semantic header/main, tabs-container, content area, and all script/style references

title: Implement tab bar UI component
description: Tab bar in JS: render tabs, click to switch, close button (×), middle-click to close. Visual active state. Handle overflow.

title: Implement content area rendering
description: Content area that displays active tab content. Delegate to appropriate renderer (markdown, code, diff) based on tab type.

title: Implement WebSocket client connection
description: Connect to ws://localhost:PORT/ws on page load. Handle all message types. Auto-reconnect on disconnect. Update UI on messages.

title: Implement dark/light mode toggle
description: Detect system preference via prefers-color-scheme. Add toggle button in UI. Apply theme class to root. Persist preference in localStorage.

title: Implement keyboard shortcuts
description: Cmd/Ctrl+1-9 switch tabs, Cmd/Ctrl+W close tab, Cmd/Ctrl+Shift+T reopen closed. Prevent browser default behaviors.

title: Create style.css with responsive layout
description: CSS for tab bar, content area, responsive breakpoints. CSS variables for theming. Clean, minimal design.

title: Serve static files from embedded assets
description: Configure HTTP handler to serve index.html at /, static files from web/ directory using http.FileServer with embedded FS.
close_reason: Already fully implemented: static.go has go:embed, ServeStaticFile with SPA fallback, getContentType; server.go routes GET / to handleStatic; handlers.go delegates to ServeStaticFile; static_test.go has comprehensive tests. All tests passing.

title: Epic: Code Rendering
description: Implement syntax-highlighted code display with line numbers and copy button using highlight.js.

title: Implement code renderer with highlight.js
description: Render code content with highlight.js. Auto-detect language from file extension or use specified language. Full file highlighting.

title: Add line numbers to code view
description: Display line numbers alongside code. Proper alignment, styling. Support selecting line ranges.

title: Add copy button to code view
description: Copy button in corner of code view. Use Clipboard API. Show feedback on copy (checkmark, tooltip).

title: Style code view for dark/light themes
description: CSS for code view container, line numbers gutter, syntax theme integration. Support both dark and light modes.

title: Epic: Markdown Rendering
description: Implement markdown rendering with GFM, Mermaid diagrams, and KaTeX math support using vendor libraries.

comments.author: peterengelbrecht
comments.text: Iteration 9: agentviewer-qdd.1 | Verified marked.js GFM integration already complete: v15.0.5 loaded in index.html, configured with gfm:true in app.js configureMarked(), renders via marked.parse() in renderMarkdown(). Tested server with GFM content (tables, task lists, strikethrough, autolinks, code blocks). All tests pass.

title: Integrate marked.js for GFM rendering
description: Configure marked.js with GFM options: tables, task lists, strikethrough, autolinks. Set up renderer in app.js.
close_reason: marked.js v15.0.5 already integrated: loaded in index.html, configured with GFM enabled in app.js configureMarked(), renders via renderMarkdown(). Supports tables, task lists, strikethrough, autolinks, and code blocks.

title: Integrate highlight.js for code blocks in markdown
description: Configure marked.js to use highlight.js for fenced code blocks. Auto-detect language or use specified language hint.

title: Integrate Mermaid for diagram rendering
description: Detect mermaid code blocks, render as SVG diagrams. Support flowcharts, sequence diagrams, etc. Handle rendering errors gracefully.

title: Integrate KaTeX for math rendering
description: Detect inline math ($...$) and block math ($$...$$). Render with KaTeX. Handle rendering errors.

title: Style markdown output
description: CSS for rendered markdown: typography, tables, code blocks, task lists, blockquotes. Support dark/light themes.
